sub_title: Senior R&D Manager promoting health, safety and sustainability
summary:
I am an ambitious people manager, who is focused on facilitating to get high (quality) output from the team and to allow optimum development of staff. Additionally I am an experienced portfolio, program and project manager who understands the need for careful stakeholder management. Currently in EFFoST my activities are mainly dedicated to participate in several Horizon Europe R&I projects and to contribute to write proposals for new consortia. This makes that it is key to strive for results that support the F2F strategy and the EU Green Deal. As a result there is a strong focus on the development of innovations that promote reduction of emission of GHGs and support of sustainable practices, like fighting child and forces labour and reduce food waste. Two large projects EFFoST is currently involved in TITAN, developing digital innovations to build transparency in the food supply chain and GIANTLEAPS, promoting the consumption of alternative proteins for more sustainable and healthier diets
In Yili Innovation Center Europe with our team we will be supporting innovation initiatives with Head Quarters and R&D in China. In Arla I was heading several initiatives targeting food safety and shelf life. In Nutricia/ Danone I lead a number NPD projects from idea to launch including patent protection by leading multi-disciplinary teams with colleagues from Marketing, Medical, Regulatory, Research, Operations, and Product Development. I like to take initiatives and to connect people. 

Specialties: 
Global and R&D portfolio/program/project management 
New Product Development / Open innovation
Quality Environmental Health and Safety, 
Establishing partnerships with academia, institutes, KOL’s
Accomplished scientific and technical presenter / trainer 
> 20 publications in scientific journals 
Inventor on several patents

Areas of expertise:
Dairy Technology, Protein Technology, 
Food Safety Management
Physical Chemistry of food ingredients / Rheology of food hydrocolloids, 
Life Sciences / Health & Nutrition, 
Medical Nutrition and Infant Nutrition,
Undernutrition/Oropharyngeal dysphagia.

education.field_of_study: Latin, Dutch, English, French, Mathematics I, Biology, History

profile_positions.description:
In this exciting role I support the European Federation of Food Science and Technology (EFFoST) to facilitate knowledge and technology exchange among food professionals. EFFoST creates opportunities for food scientist, engineers, technologists, policymakers and businesses in food and food-related areas to connect and collaborate with the objective to enhance the uptake of new technologies and developments. By supporting the further development of food science and technology, EFFoST aims to advance the production of sustainable and healthy food for all in a changing world. Within EFFoST we participate in writing proposals for EU R&I projects, and of course we also participate in executing these projects once they are selected for funding. 
At this moment I have several responsibilities in EU R&I projects:
INGREEN: Lead WP8 on "Innovation Outreach, Impact and Exploitation", 
AQUABIOPROFIT: lead WP7 on "Dissemination, Education, Marketing and Exploitation", 
GiantLeaps: lead WP8 on "Communication, dissemination and exploitation", 
TITAN: lead WP9 on "Communication, Training, Dissemination, and Network of Expertise".
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Senior Open Innovation Manager responsible for:
1) Sports & Medical Nutrition: leading a roadmap on sports nutrition which includes: new launches of dairy-based nutrition products focused on sports, new NPD initiatives where we innovate with new science-based ingredients, and new strategic research projects with leading scientists to develop the future in sports nutrition. 
2). Food Safety & Regulatory: leading a roadmap on food safety and quality management which includes: establishing an expert office for risk assessment in Yili, building expertise in predictive modelling and challenge testing, new strategic research projects with leading scientists on specific micro-organisms relevant to Yili, and building expertise in product development areas new for Yili. 
3) Circular economy: stimulating a set of initiatives to make dairy production more sustainable, like zero water dairy, decreasing carbon footprint, reduction of packaging waste etc.
profile_positions.title: Senior Open Innovation Manager

profile_positions.description:
Senior R&D Manager responsible for:
1). The Microbial Food Safety Team, which is responsible for expert scientific input in matters concerning shelf life and food safety within Arla Foods for all product categories. As a team we closely cooperate with QEHS. We give support in issues at dairies and improvement of food safety management. 
2). The Shelf Life Intelligence Program, which is one of the TOP strategic innovation programs of Arla Research. The program is focused on delivering clean label, natural solutions to extend the shelf life of Arla's dairy products. This is typically achieved by supporting the dairy in improving the hygiene, in combination with adding additional hurdles in the product/packaging.
profile_positions.title: Senior R&D Manager

profile_positions.description:
NIZO food research: project manager – senior scientist dairy protein technology responsible for:
-	Project management of multiple contract research projects on the field of dairy protein technology on a wide range of applications (infant nutrition, powder processing, protein-dense products, milk protein applications, valorisation of waste streams, encapsulation and controlled release etc) with multi-national companies located in: US/Canada, Latin America, Europe, Japan etc.
-	Developing of long-term projects as PhD-projects and consortia with partner research and R&D organisations on the use of dairy proteins and/or proteins from plant origin in several different nutritional  applications. 
-	Developing and positioning of the SIMPHYD platform on in vitro simulation of physiological digestion in cooperation with a colleague of the health department.
-	Expert in several TIFN projects on behalf of NIZO.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - senior scientist protein technology

profile_positions.description:

- Contact from Research with global teams (marketing, medical, regulatory, operations) and countries, 
- Scientific supervision of clinical trials on the area of dysphagia (patients with swallowing problems) and concentrated oral supplements (TOAD study, CALEX study). 
- Support Global Medical and countries for the following product groups: dysphagia, concentrated oral supplements.

profile_positions.description:
Finalizing PhD-thesis on the Large-Deformation Properties of Wheat Flour and Gluten Dough under supervision of Professor A. Prins and Associate Professor T. van Vliet of the Department of Food Physics of Wageningen University.

volunteer_experiences.description: From May 2015 onwards I have continuously coached and trained youth field hockey teams within the MHK, but also two International Schools in Aarhus (AAGE and Kochs skole). It is a privilege to support these kids in playing such a technical sport: to exercise, to have fun together and to achieve goals together. Most of all I like to help all players to improve their skills.

From September 2011 onwards I manage the arrangement of referees to matches of F, E, D and C junior teams of the outdoors competition. The referees are mostly youth players from A and B junior teams, parents with hockey experience, and others. In this role I am a member of the Match and Referee Committee that is responsible for the arrangement of the matches, the referees, and the education of the referees.
